page.title: 12BLACKBURN PLAYBUS
page.content: The Blackburn and District{Playbus}is a place of{recreation}for{pre-school children.It has two full time and two part time{helpers}.The mums have to pay 70p for the children to use the Playbus.It comes to Belmont on Tuesdays and Fridays,staying for two hours each day.About 7-15 children attend.The Playbus is sent to Belmont because it is a small place and there are no playgroups in the village.The children are encouraged to make use of all the Playbus facilities. "Messy" play - sand, water, modelling and painting - is done downstairs. Upstairs is a quieter area with toys and a Wendy House.The children are given a drink and biscuit. They are encouraged to produce a picture, listen to stories and join in songs. In good weather a slide and inflatable are used outside.
